title: Microservices Communication Tax
context: A growing engineering team decides to break their monolith into microservices. The promise: independent deployments, team autonomy, technology flexibility. The reality: every function call that was once in-process now crosses a network boundary. The communication tax compounds with every new service.
hypothesis: Microservices give teams independence and allow faster, safer deployments.

effects.label: Every internal call becomes a network call

children.label: Need circuit breakers, retries, timeouts everywhere
Partial failures become the norm, not the exception
Debugging data inconsistencies requires cross-service tracing
Need service mesh for traffic management
Need centralized logging across all services
Need API gateway for external traffic

effects.label: Team coordination doesn't disappear — it shifts

dontIf: Your team is smaller than 30 engineers
Your monolith deploys in under 15 minutes
You don't have dedicated platform/infra engineers
Your scaling bottleneck is the database, not the application
ifYouMust: Start with 2-3 services at natural domain boundaries, not 50
Invest in observability before splitting — you'll need it
Define API contracts and versioning strategy upfront
Accept that you're trading code complexity for operational complexity

alternatives.name: Service-oriented monolith
alternatives.note: Internal modules with clean interfaces, single deployment

alternatives.name: Selective extraction
alternatives.note: Extract only the 1-2 services with genuine scaling needs

sources.title: Martin Fowler — Microservice Prerequisites
sources.note: Lists operational maturity requirements most teams lack

sources.title: Segment Engineering Blog — Goodbye Microservices
sources.note: Segment moved back to monolith after microservices complexity

sources.title: Amazon Prime Video — Monolith Saves 90%
sources.note: Prime Video moved from microservices to monolith, cut costs 90%

falsifiability: Teams under 30 engineers consistently report net productivity gains from microservices
P99 latency does not increase meaningfully after decomposition
Infrastructure costs remain flat or decrease after microservices adoption

seo.description: Microservices replace code complexity with operational complexity: +300-900% latency, +200-400% infra cost, exponentially harder debugging. Evidence from Segment, Amazon Prime Video.
